turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about L-function.
turn.2: L-function In mathematics, an L-function is a meromorphic function on the complex plane, associated to one out of several categories of mathematical objects.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: An L-series is a Dirichlet series, usually convergent on a half-plane, that may give rise to an L-function via analytic continuation.
turn.5: What did you find the most interesting fact about the L-function?
turn.6: The theory of "L"-functions has become a very substantial, and still largely conjectural, part of contemporary analytic number theory.
turn.8: In it, broad generalisations of the Riemann zeta function and the "L"-series for a Dirichlet character are constructed, and their general properties, in most cases still out of reach of proof, are set out in a systematic way.
turn.9: Did you find any other interesting aspects of the L-function?
turn.10: We distinguish at the outset between the L-series, an infinite series representation (for example the Dirichlet series for the Riemann zeta function), and the L-function, the function in the complex plane that is its analytic continuation.
turn.12: The general constructions start with an "L"-series, defined first as a Dirichlet series, and then by an expansion as an Euler product indexed by prime numbers.
